title: Rebekah Vardy shares support to ‘anyone struggling’ amid Coleen Rooney row
text:
The pair have been embroiled in a public feud (Pictures: Getty)

Rebekah Vardy has been sharing motivational messages for ‘anyone struggling’ amid her row with Coleen Rooney.

After Coleen accused Rebekah of selling stories about her to the press (claims which Jamie Vardy’s wife strongly denied), the internet has been enthralled by their public row.

Following Becky’s shady return to social media, she’s shared a message on her Instagram Stories.

‘It’s okay to feel unstable. It’s okay to disassociate. It’s okay to hide from the world,’ it read. ‘It’s okay to need help. It’s okay not to be okay. Your mental illness is not a personal failure.’

She shared a message about mental health (Picture: Instagram/beckyvardy)

The 37-year-old added praise hands emojis to the post, and added: ‘For anyone that is struggling.’

It comes after she mocked her former friend in a tweet which saw her celebrating her husband’s success on the football field as Leicester City FC scooped up a record-breaking win.

Advertisement

To the surprise of many, Rebekah broke her social media silence by tweeting: ‘It’s…… Jamie Vardy #9.’

The choice of an ellipsis was also used by Coleen at the end of her dramatic statement in which she alleged that Rebekah had been selling stories to newspapers about the Rooney family.

Rooney made the accusations on Instagram, alleging that she set up a plot to expose her fellow WAG by only allowing one account access to fake stories she was sharing, and that account was Rebekah’s.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account,’ she shared on 9 October.

Meanwhile, Becky strongly denied the claims when she fired back in a statement of her own.

‘As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this,’ she wrote. ‘I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for.

‘If you thought this was happening you could have told me and I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped.

‘Over the years various people have had access to my insta & just this week I found I was following people I didn’t know and have never followed myself.’

She added: ‘I’m not being funny but I don’t need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?

‘I like you a lot Coleen & I’m so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I’m heavily pregnant.

‘I’m disgusted that I’m even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened.’
